content: the stopgap mitten by emilio thumbgusset sizes included extra large adult large adult medium adult small adult older child younger child toddler date of pattern october 17 2024 note on materials while youcan use any circular needles i personally used kollage square circulars size 5u s 3 75mm 16inch knitting needles for this pattern they helped maintain even gauge and create neat stitches yarn used in development i used loops & threads impeccable worsted weight yarn for developing this pattern feel free to use any similar worsted weight yarn of your choice note on cast on for this pattern i used a specific long tail thumb cast on method youcan watch my video tutorial emilio shows long tail thumb cast on onyoutube for a step-by-step guide aboutthe stopgap mitten this pattern is designed to eliminate those annoying little gaps around the baseof the thumb that need to be sewn closed when knitting the traditional style mitten the stopgap pattern features a vertical thumbhole constructed byflat-knitting purl and knit row after the cuff which is knit in the round then rejoining in the round to complete the hand the thumb stitches are then picked uparound the vertical thumbhole in a way similar to picking upstitches around the armhole of a sweater the thumb is knit and yes we have no gaps only a neat seam enjoy knitting these mittens and say goodbye to those pesky thumbhole gaps 1 notes this mitten pattern is designed specifically for the twocirculars method of knitting in the round this technique involves using two circular knitting needles to knit in the round offering greater flexibility and ease of handling especially for smaller circumferences like mitten cuffs and fingers advantages of two circulars method 1 even stitch distribution by dividing your stitches evenly between two circular needles you maintain better control and even gauge 2 easier handling compared to double-pointed needles dpns using two circular needles can feel less cumbersome and less likely to drop stitches 3 smooth transitions this method helps in creating a smooth ladder-free transition between needles which is essential for a neat and professional finish adapting for dpns and magic loop methods while this pattern is optimized for the twocirculars method it can be adapted for dpns and the magic loop method with a few adjustments for dpns double-pointed needles stitch distribution divide your stitches evenly across four needles using the fifth needle to knit markers place a marker at the beginning of the round and another halfway around the round to mark the decreases hand decreases follow the pattern for hand decreases making sure to slip the markers and maintain the 4-stitch decrease per round for magic loop method stitch distribution use a long circular needle ensuring half the stitches are oneach side of the cable hand decreases follow the same decrease pattern as the twocirculars method maintaining even gauge disclaimer this is my original pattern the result of much experimentation over the course of a year i used the bing copilot
